value.title: The Register calls for aid, and Microsoft's Rohan Kumar will answer... our questions about SQL Edge and Azure Synapse
value.excerpt: Build There was SQL Edge and Azure Synapse news at Microsoft's reimagined Build gathering this week, so The Register had a chat with corporate vice president Rohan Kumar about the company's database ambitions.

value.title: Microsoft, in collaboration with OpenAI, unveils AI supercomputer
value.excerpt: During its Build 2020 developer conference on Tuesday, Microsoft unveiled the new supercomputer built in collaboration with OpenAI, an artificial intelligence startup found by Elon Musk. Microsoft announced that the supercomputer hosted in Azure was developed exclusively to train OpenAI’s large-scale artificial intelligence models.

images.title: Microsoft, in collaboration with OpenAI, unveils AI supercomputer

value.title: Meeting the challenges of today and tomorrow with Azure AI
value.excerpt:
It’s inspiring to see how customers continue to reimagine how they work with the help of AI, which is more important today than ever. value.title: Microsoft's Powerful Supercomputer Will Supercharge AI for Azure Developers
value.excerpt: At its online-only Build 2020, Microsoft unveils the fifth-most-powerful supercomputer on Earth, which is designed to run massive machine-learning AI projects, plus some new tools to ensure responsible use of AI.

value.title: Microsoft Certified: Azure AI Fundamentals
value.excerpt: This certification will be available on or around June 8, 2020. Azure AI Fundamentals validates foundational knowledge of machine learning and artificial intelligence concepts and related Microsoft Azure services.

value.title: Microsoft helps Sony power the world’s first AI image sensor with Azure
value.excerpt: Sony is the top image sensor supplier to the smartphone industry and has a presence in other segments as well. The IMX500 is designed to power enterprise systems such as industrial cameras for monitoring product lines.

value.title: Microsoft readies more developer tools for its 'Project Cortex' knowledge-management service
